title: Water parks and pools
text:
Military Life Water parks and pools A view of Yomiuriland Water Amusement Island in Tokyo. This outdoor park has three different types of water sliders, Giant Sky River — a huge complex of water slides — and diving pool, wave pool, children’s pool and whirlpool. www.yomiuriland.co.jp. Courtesy Yomiuriland Water Amusment Island WAI. Japanese water parks banning people with tattoos from entering premises Japan 
TOSHIMAEN SWIMMING POOL (Tokyo): Through Aug. 31, 9 a.m.-6 p.m.; outdoor water park with Hydro Polis, a huge complex of water slides and tubes; seven types of swimming pools; diving pool with 1- and 3-meter diving boards; and 50-meter pool for competitive swimmers available; one-day pass for swimming pool/unlimited rides in amusement park: 4,200 yen adults, 3,200 yen for A — those 110 cm or higher — 2,200 yen for B — those under 110 cm; pool pass is 4,000 yen adults, 3,000 yen children A, 2,000 yen children B; 3-25-1 Kouyama, Nerima-ku, Toshima-en Station, Seibu Ikebukuro Line. 
TOBU DOBUTSU KOEN SUPER POOL (Saitama prefecture): Through Aug. 31, Sept. 5-6 & 12-13, 9:30 a.m.-5 p.m.; outdoor water park includes Super Slider (a snaky complex of water sliders), a wave pool, children’s pool and a whirlpool; one-day pass (swimming pool/amusement park/unlimited ride in amusement park): 4,800 yen adults, 3,700 yen children; swimming pool pass: 2,400 yen adults, 1,100 yen children; 110, Suka, Miyashiro-machi Minami Saitama-gun, Saitama; 7.0 km from Kuki I.C., Tohoku Expressway. 
KODOMONO KUNI SWIMMING POOL (Yokohama): Through Aug. 31, 10 a.m.-4 p.m., closed on Wed., open Aug. 12; water slides and tubes, children’s pool and 25-meter pool for swimmers in a natural hiking field and playground; 700 Nara-cho, Aoba-ku; 1,100 yen adults, 450 yen elementary and junior high school students, 350 yen infants; 045-961-2111. 
INAGE KAIHIN KOEN POOL (Chiba): Through Aug. 31, 9 a.m.-5 p.m.; 14 varieties of pools with water slides; 7-1-1, Takahama, Mihama-ku, Chiba city; 6 km via Route 357 from Wangan Chiba I.C., Higashi Kanto Expressway; 1,100 yen adults, 800 yen high school students, 400 yen elementary and junior high school students, 200 yen ages 4 & younger; 043-247-2771. 
UGOKAS (Tokyo): Through Aug. 31, 10 a.m.-6 p.m.; water amusement park in Toyosu features 120-meter water slide, Zero-Shock diving from board at 6 meters high, zip line and more; 4,800 yen adults, 3,800 yen children; two-minute walk from Shin Toyosu Station on Yurikamome (monorail); 03-3219-1211. 
HAMURA AQUATIC PARK (Tokyo): Through Aug. 31, 10 a.m.-6 p.m.; 15-minute walk from JR Hamura Station; 300 yen adults, 100 yen children for two hours, 600 yen adults, 200 yen children for one day; 042-555-0013. 
FUCHU OUTDOOR POOL (Tokyo): Through Aug. 31, 10 a.m.-5 p.m.; Kyodo-no Mori Sogo Swimming Pool, two-minute walk from Kyodo-no Mori Sogo Taikukan Bus Stop after taking a bus from Fuchu on Keio Line; 150 yen adults, 100 yen senior high school students, 50 yen children for local residents, 300 yen adults, 200 yen senior high school students, 100 yen children for others; 042-363-8111. 
SHOWA KINEN PARK RAINBOW POOL (Tokyo): Through Sept. 6, 9:30 a.m.-6:30 p.m., until 5 p.m. weekdays in Sept.; Rainbow pool is nine different types of swimming pools; 3173 Midori-cho, Tachikawa City, Nishi-Tachikawa Station, JR Ome Line; 2,300 yen adults, 1,200 yen elementary and junior high school students, 300 yen for ages 4 & 5; after 2 p.m., 1,150, 600 & 150 yen respectively; season passport available. 
AQUA PARADISE PATIO (Saitama prefecture): year-round, 10 a.m.-9 p.m., through Aug. 31 9 a.m.-9 p.m., closed Tue. except August; indoor amusement pool, has pools, water slide, children’s pool, wave pool, and sauna baths; 15-minute drive from Hanazono I.C. on Kanetsu Express; 1,000 yen adults, 500 yen kids; 048-574-5000. 
SEIBU-EN SWIMMING POOL (Saitama prefecture): Through Sept. 6, 9 a.m.-5 p.m., closed Sept. 2 & 3; Seibu-en amusement park’s swimming pool has water slides, wave pool, floating pool, and children’s pool plus all you-can-ride; 2964 Yamaguchi, Tokorozawa-city; Seibu Yuenchi Station, Seibu Line; 2,800 yen adults, 1,700 yen kids; swim only: 2,200 yen adults, 1,200 yen kids; 04-2922-1371. 
YOKOHAMA POOL CENTER: Through Sept. 6, 9 a.m.-5 p.m.; children’s pool and 2,953-foot round-shape whirlpool; 14-1, Haramachi, Isogo-ku, Yokohama city, Kanagawa; 8-minute walk from Negishi station, JR Negishi Line; 800 yen adults, 200 yen kids; 045-761-1948. 
HONMOKU SHIMIN POOL (Yokohama): Through Sept. 6, 9 a.m.-5 p.m.; water slides, children’s pool and 485-foot round-shape whirlpool; 46-1, Honmoku motomachi, Naka-ku, Yokohama city, Kanagawa; Municipal bus no. 54 or 97 from Negishi Station, JR Negishi Line to Honmoku Shimin Koen Mae bus stop; 800 yen adults, 200 yen children; 045-621-5012. 
TSUJIDO JUMBO SWIMMING POOL (Kanagawa prefecture): Through Sept. 13, 9 a.m.-6 p.m.; water slide, waterfalls and children’s pool and wave pool for swimmers; 10-minute walk from Tsujido Kaihin Koen Iriguchi bus stop after taking a bus at JR Tsujido Station (south exit); 830 yen adults, 520 yen junior high school students, 210 yen elementary school students; 0466-34-0011. 
WATER ADVENTURE KINGDOM IN HUIS TEN BOSCH (Nagasaki prefecture): Through Sept. 13, 9 a.m.-10 p.m.; four large pools including Japan’s longest 180-meter water slide; 0570-064-110. 
TOKYO SUMMERLAND ADVENTURE LAGOON: Through Sept. 13; outdoor water park with swimming pools, water slides and tubes, waterfalls, and more in a tropical atmosphere; 600 Kamiyotsugi, Akiruno city; off Akiruno I.C., Ken-o-do Expressway; admission for Tokyo Summerland including Adventure Lagoon is 4,500 yen adults, 3,000 yen kids (after 3 p.m.: 3,600 and 2,100 yen); 042-558-6511. 
YOMIURILAND WATER AMUSEMENT ISLAND WAI (Tokyo): Through Sept. 13, 10 a.m.-5 p.m. weekdays, 9 a.m.-5 p.m. weekends; outdoor park of Yomiuri Water Amusement Island WAI has three different types of water sliders, Giant Sky River — a huge complex of water slides — and diving pool, wave pool, children’s pool and whirlpool; 4015-1, Yanokuchi, Inagi City, Tokyo; 5 km from Chofu I.C., Chuo Expressway; one-day pass for swimming pool, amusement park and eared seal show is 4,700 yen adults, 3,700 yen children; pool pass: 2,900 yen adults, 1,900 yen children. 
OISO LONG BEACH (Kanagawa prefecture): Through Sept. 13, 9 a.m.-5 p.m.; 546 Kokufu Hongo, Oiso Town, Naka-gun; free bus from Oiso Station, JR Tokaido Line; one-day pass: 3,700 yen adults, 2,500 yen junior high/high school students, 2,000 yen elementary school students, 1,000 yen ages 3-6; pass after 2 p.m.: 2,000 yen, 1,500 yen, 1,000 yen and 500 yen; 0463-61-1111. Okinawa 
OKINAWA SOGO UNDO KOEN: Through Sept. 30, closed Tuesdays; 25-meter indoor pool 9 a.m.-8:45 p.m., 50-meter outdoor pool 9 a.m.-7 p.m. and recreation pool 9:30 a.m.-6 p.m.; 15-minute ride from Kitanakagusuku I.C. on Okinawa Express; 098-932-5114. 
NAGO CITY B & G OCEAN CENTER POOL: Through Dec. 28, 9 a.m.-9 p.m., closed Tuesdays; jacuzzi and children’s pools; 10-minute ride from Kyoda I.C. on Okinawa Express; 320 yen adults, 160 yen kids; 0980-54-1082. Join the conversation and share your voice. 
Show Comments
